descriptions.description: A more diverse contributor base attracts a wider pool of potential new contributors to the project.
As contributors skill up, they graduate from the New Contributors stock, reducing its level.
Developer turnover directly drains the pool of Core Developers as they leave the project.
The promotion rate directly adds experienced contributors to the Core Developer stock.
Promoting experienced contributors to the core team reduces the stock of Experienced Contributors.
The skill-up flow directly adds newly competent contributors to the Experienced Contributors stock.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill acquisition by providing direct guidance and tacit knowledge.
Comprehensive documentation enables self-paced learning, thereby accelerating the skill-up process.
Mentorship helps experienced contributors demonstrate core-level competence, increasing their promotion rate.
More core developers provide more available mentors, thereby increasing implicit knowledge transfer capacity.
